definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The child glanced at his angry father timidly.
sentences.chinese: 孩子怯生生地瞟了一眼怒氣衝衝的父親。

sentences.english: She followed him diffidently through the clattering machines.
sentences.chinese: 她跟着他，怯生生地走過那些轟隆作響的機器。

sentences.english: I find myself shyer , more cautious, more anxious.
sentences.chinese: 我發現自己變得比以前怯生，謹慎，焦慮。

sentences.english: Small children are often shy of anyone they do not know.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子在陌生人面前常常是怯生生的。

sentences.english: I remember Schmeichel screaming like a pig for more protection when we played Wimbledon when he first came here.
sentences.chinese: 我記得舒梅切爾剛來打溫布爾登的時候也是怯生生的。

sentences.english: "Good-morning, " the Senator said to Jennie, when finally she came hesitatingly into the room.
sentences.chinese: “早安，”他當珍妮終於怯生生進來的時候對她說。

sentences.english: He was horribly scare usuaslyd now.
The boy asked timidly if he might see the book.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩怯生生地問能否看一下這本書。

definition: in a fine voice (idiom); softly spoken
fear of strangers/to be afraid of strangers (of small children)
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
